Dear Mr. Kolodchin:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 18, 2019. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.\ An
explanation why previous corrective action plans have not obtained and
maintained compliance for rules found in repeat non-compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4108 Financing and audit.
A licensee shall do all of the following:
(a) Obtain an annual audit of all financial accounts. Audits for
nongovernmental institutions shall be conducted by an
independent certified public accountant who is not
administratively related to the agency.
(d) Develop a budget that includes projected income and
expenditures.
The agency did not submit an independent annual financial
audit or budget of projected income and expenditures.
R 400.4111 Job description.
An institution shall provide a job description for each staff
position that identifies rules, required qualifications, and lines of
authority.
In one of four new employee records reviewed, the record did
not show documentation of job description for the employee
identified as a nurse.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(b) A true copy of verification of education from an accredited
college or university where minimum education requirements
are specified by rule.
In one of four new employee records reviewed, the record did
not show proof of education for the employee identified as a
nurse.
4

R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and which
are less than 12 months old.
Three of four new employee records reviewed did not show
compliance:
 Two records did not show documentation of any
references.
 A third record showed documentation of only two
references.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(f) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following entities:
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or the
equivalent state law enforcement agency, Canadian province, or
other country where the person usually resides or has resided in
the previous 5 years.
(ii) From an entity accessing either Michigan state police
records or equivalent state, Canadian provincial, or other
country law enforcement agency where the person usually
resides or has resided in the previous 5 years.
Two of four new employee records reviewed did not show
compliance:
 One record showed the employee’s ICHAT was
completed on 8/19/2019, five days after the employee’s
8/14/2019 date of hire.
 A second record showed the employee’s ICHAT was
completed on 5/20/2019, five days after the employee’s
5/15/2019 date of hire.
5

R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
One of four new employee records reviewed did not show
documentation of a children services clearance for the
employee whose date of hire was 5/15/2019.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
Two of eight employee records reviewed did not show
compliance:
 One record did not show documentation of the
employee’s six month written evaluation due by
11/15/2019.
 A second record did not show documentation of the
employee’s annual evaluation due by 5/23/2019.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
6

employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Five of eight employee records reviewed did not show
compliance:
 One record did not show documentation of a tuberculosis
screening for the employee hired 5/15/2019.
 A second record showed the employee’s tuberculosis
screening was completed on 8/16/2019, two days after
the employee’s 8/14/2019 date of hire.
 A third record showed the employee’s tuberculosis
screening was completed on 11/22/2019, four days after
the employee’s 11/18/2019 date of hire.
 A four record showed the employee’s annual tuberculosis
screening due by 11/30/2019 was completed late on
12/29/2018.
 A fifth record showed the employee’s annual tuberculosis
screening due by 12/1/2019 was completed late on
12/7/2018.
Repeat Violation Interim-February 2019.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum
of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training
annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
Two of eight employee records reviewed showed less than 25
clock hours of annual training.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(4) Training opportunities for direct care staff shall include,
but are not limited to, all of the following:
(h) First aid.
The agency requires that new employees be CPR and first aid
trained within 90 days of hire.
In one of four new employee records reviewed the employee’s
training due by 11/14/2019, was not documented.
7

Repeat Violation Interim-February 2019.
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's
case record:
(b) A photograph taken within the previous 12 months.
One of two open resident records reviewed did not show
documentation of a photograph of the resident.
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of
the following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that remain to be
met.
Eight of eight closed resident records reviewed did not show
document of the resident’s needs that remain to be met.
Repeat Violation-Interim-February 2019.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
None at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.4166 Discharge plan(c):
The agency was advised adding the statement outlined in subrule (c) to its discharge
form/summary may aid it in showing compliance to the rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. That corrective action plan related to its
February 2019 Interim inspection where it received seven rule violations. The agency
was not successful with that corrective action plan. It received three repeat violations
this inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
